answers.answer: Don't panic as long as the baby is healthy and ready to come out everything will be fine Sometimes the dates be off

Wow I have never heard of that happening so I can't speak from experience but I'm sure if your baby was at risk or there was something abnormal in a negative way, your doctor would warn you about it and lay out the harsh news. Did he/she tell you there were concerns because of this?
i measuring a few weeks ahead of schedule and my boy was born at 37 weeks weighing 10lbs 8oz healthy as a horse and eats like a piggyhe is a month and 5 days old now and weighs 11lbs 5oz

The only thing she said was that 50% of the time they don't know why this happens and then 30% of the time it's because of gestational diabetes and 20% of the time it can be due to some type of virus. She didn't seem too too worried or tell me to be on bed rest or anything. The only thing she said is my amniotic fluid level isn't considered high (it's still within normal limits) but it's beginning to be borderline. She is pretty much waiting for my results to come back. She said if anything abnormal came back she would call me.

question: I posted this in the 25-30 year old group but only got one response, hoping to get more feedback. Here's my situation. I'm on my 3rd pregnancy (first two with zero complication add healthy baby girls) and I am 30 weeks pregnant. At my last appointment (28 weeks) I was measuring 32 weeks. Yesterday at my appointment I was measuring 38 weeks. I am not swelling or have no signs of preeclampsia or anything and I passed my one hour glucose test. Doctor ordered the 3 hour test just to rule out gestational diabetes and some more lab work bi have ultrasound scheduled for tomorrow. My question is has anyone had this happen to them? Where they just grew so big and everything turn out ok? Could my dates just be off and baby be coming earlier than expected? Any/all advice appreciated! :)
title: Advice please
